title: Typhoon-hit Southeast Asian countries to see rainier end to 2024
summary: Southeast Asia could see higher-than-normal rainfall in the coming months, threatening further disruptions to agriculture, tourism, and industrial output in a region already hit by a series of storms this year.
content:
(Oct 15): Southeast Asia could see higher-than-normal rainfall in the coming months, threatening further disruptions to agriculture, tourism, and industrial output in a region already hit by a series of storms this year.

Weather forecasters predict wetter conditions from the Philippines to Vietnam through November, in large part because of the emerging La Niña phenomenon, which moves warm water toward the western Pacific Ocean and brings more rainfall over the region.

title: Malaysia's industrial output to keep growing, say economists in dismissing August's data concerns
summary: Malaysia’s industrial output is expected to continue growing in the remaining months of 2024, thanks to global demand recovery that keeps the production wheels turning at the country's export-oriented factories.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 14): Malaysia’s industrial output is expected to continue growing in the remaining months of 2024, thanks to global demand recovery that keeps the production wheels turning at the country's export-oriented factories.

External demand for key electrical and electronics goods appears intact, economists said, pointing to resilient manufacturing conditions as shown by Malaysia’s September purchasing managers index (PMI) that provided an early indication of the sector's performance.

content:
